snippet: Wall Street is betting on a game-changing election. But analysts paint a murky picture of the campaign, with a Mitt Romney victory that is likely to produce both wins and losses for Wall Street.
abstract: Wall Street is betting on a game-changing election. But analysts paint a murky picture of the campaign, with a Mitt Romney victory that is likely to produce both wins and losses for Wall Street.

byline.original: By BEN PROTESS and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

headline.main: An Election Guide for Wall Street

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
